comments.label: [[Appliances Tested]] Note
comments.text: Built-in kitchen appliances present at the time of inspection were tested using normal controls unless otherwise noted. Portable or personal appliances were not evaluated.
comments.notesToAI: Use as default overview when at least one major appliance was tested.

comments.label: [[Inspection Scope – Appliances]] Limitation
comments.text: The appliance inspection is limited to basic operation using normal controls. Internal components, timers, calibration, and specialty features are not tested.
comments.notesToAI: Standard boilerplate for the appliance section.

comments.label: [[Range Operational]] Note
comments.text: The range/stove responded to normal controls and appeared to function as intended at the time of inspection.

comments.label: [[Range Burner Igniter Inoperative]] Repair
comments.text: One or more range burners at (location) did not ignite using the automatic igniter. Cleaning or repair is recommended.
comments.notesToAI: Use when a gas burner will light with a match but the igniter fails.

comments.label: [[Range Igniter Continues Sparking]] Repair
comments.text: The range igniter continued to spark after the burner was lit. Adjustment or repair is recommended.
comments.notesToAI: Use for comment you’ve used before: starter does not stop sparking after burners are lit.

comments.label: [[Range Anti-Tip Device Missing]] Safety Issue
comments.text: An anti-tip device was not observed for the range. These devices help prevent the appliance from tipping if weight is applied to an open door. Installation of an approved anti-tip bracket is recommended.

comments.label: [[Refrigerator Not Inspected – Personal Appliance]] Limitation
comments.text: The refrigerator present at the time of inspection appears to be a personal appliance and may not remain with the home; it was not evaluated as part of this inspection.
comments.notesToAI: Use by default when refrigerator is not clearly included with the sale.

comments.label: [[Refrigerator Operational – Basic Check]] Note
comments.text: A basic check of the refrigerator/freezer found it to be running and cooling at the time of inspection. Performance over time is not determined.
comments.notesToAI: Use when you did perform a basic test.

comments.label: [[Microwave Operational]] Note
comments.text: The built-in microwave responded to normal controls at the time of inspection.

comments.label: [[Microwave Not Tested – Portable]] Limitation
comments.text: Countertop/portable microwaves are considered personal appliances and were not evaluated.

comments.label: [[Disposer Operational]] Note
comments.text: The waste disposer responded to normal controls at the time of inspection.

comments.label: [[Debris in Disposer]] Repair
comments.text: Debris was observed inside the waste disposer. We recommend the disposer be cleaned and any foreign material removed to reduce the risk of damage or jamming.
comments.notesToAI: Use for your frequent 'debris in disposer' / 'debris in disposal' observation.

comments.label: [[Disposer Leaking]] Repair
comments.text: The waste disposer at (location) is leaking. Repair or replacement is recommended.

comments.label: [[Cooktop Operational]] Note
comments.text: The cooktop responded to normal controls and appeared to function as intended at the time of inspection.

comments.label: [[Cooktop Igniter Inoperative]] Repair
comments.text: The automatic igniter for the gas cooktop did not function properly during testing. Cleaning or repair is recommended.
comments.notesToAI: Matches the comment you’ve used: automatic igniter did not function during testing.

comments.label: [[Cooktop Breaker Off]] Note
comments.text: Power to the cooktop was turned off at the electrical panel at the time of inspection. The unit was not operated.
comments.notesToAI: Use when you find the breaker off and choose not to energize.

comments.label: [[Oven Operational – Basic]] Note
comments.text: The built-in oven responded to normal controls and warmed when tested. Temperature calibration was not verified.

comments.label: [[Oven Not Tested]] Limitation
comments.text: The built-in oven was not operated due to (reason).
comments.notesToAI: Inspector should fill in the reason: items stored inside, power off, etc.

comments.label: [[Washer Not Inspected – Personal Appliance]] Limitation
comments.text: The clothes washer present appears to be a personal appliance and may not remain with the home; it was not inspected.
comments.notesToAI: Use as your default stance since you only occasionally inspect laundry appliances.

comments.label: [[Washer Operated – Basic]] Note
comments.text: The clothes washer was run through a short cycle and appeared to operate without obvious leakage. Long-term performance is not determined.
comments.notesToAI: Use when you *do* test the washer.

comments.label: [[Washing Machine Drain Pan Recommended]] Improve
comments.text: The washing machine is located in a finished area of the home. Installing a properly drained washing machine pan would help reduce the risk of hidden water damage if leakage occurs.
comments.notesToAI: Use when the washer is above finished flooring or over drywall/paneling rather than bare concrete.

comments.label: [[Dryer Not Inspected – Personal Appliance]] Limitation
comments.text: The clothes dryer present appears to be a personal appliance and may not remain with the home; it was not inspected.

comments.label: [[Dryer Operated – Basic]] Note
comments.text: The clothes dryer responded to normal controls and produced heat when tested. Internal lint accumulation and long-term performance are beyond the scope of this inspection.

comments.label: [[Dryer Venting Concern]] Repair
comments.text: A concern was noted with the dryer exhaust venting at (location), such as excessive length, kinks, or non-smooth duct material. Correction is recommended for safety and efficiency.
comments.notesToAI: You can tweak the specific issue when you insert it.

comments.label: [[Door Bell Operational]] Note
comments.text: The door bell responded to its test button at the time of inspection.

comments.label: [[Door Bell Inoperative]] Repair
comments.text: The door bell did not respond to normal controls at the time of inspection. Repair is recommended.

comments.label: [[Trash Compactor Not Present]] Note
comments.text: No trash compactor was installed at the time of inspection.

comments.label: [[Trash Compactor Not Tested]] Limitation
comments.text: The trash compactor, if present, was not operated as part of this inspection.

comments.label: [[Kitchen Exhaust Operational]] Note
comments.text: The kitchen exhaust fan responded to normal controls at the time of inspection.

comments.label: [[Kitchen Exhaust Vents Indoors]] Improve
comments.text: The kitchen exhaust fan appears to discharge back into the room or into a recirculating filter instead of venting to the exterior. While common, venting to the exterior is generally preferred to reduce moisture and cooking odors.
comments.notesToAI: Use for over-the-range microwaves or hoods that don’t vent outside.

comments.label: [[Dishwasher Operational – Basic]] Note
comments.text: The dishwasher was run through a short cycle and appeared to operate without obvious leakage. A full wash cycle and drying performance are beyond the scope of this inspection.

comments.label: [[Dishwasher Supplied with Cold Water]] Improve/Repair
comments.text: The dishwasher appears to be supplied with cold water. For best cleaning performance, most manufacturers recommend a hot water supply. Correction is recommended when practical.
comments.notesToAI: Matches your prior comment about dishwasher on cold water, upgraded to repair if you want.

comments.label: [[Dishwasher Leakage]] Repair
comments.text: Signs of leakage were observed at the dishwasher at (location). Evaluation and repair by an appliance technician or plumber are recommended.

comments.label: [[Dishwasher Drain High Loop/Air Gap]] Improve
comments.text: The dishwasher drain line lacks a visible high loop or air gap at the sink. Adding a high loop or air gap is recommended to help prevent sink water from backing into the dishwasher.
comments.notesToAI: Use when the drain line is low under the sink.

comments.label: [[Appliance General Tip]] Note
comments.text: Many appliances are near or beyond their original manufacturer warranty period. Future repair or replacement should be anticipated as part of normal home ownership.
